svg:

OOP is the marriage of "State" and "Behavior"State - data, variables, related to time.OOP Languages must have the ability to support:1. Encapsulation - provides abstraction (black box) - "Capsule" - The data is in a capsule (a protective boundary) - The capsule exposes behaviors that let you use, modify, etc. that data. - 2. Polymorphism3. Inheritance4. *Runtime Type Inspection1. Cohesion - how well things go together. - Highly Cohesive code (high cohesion is good.)2. Coupling - the strength of relationships between code thingies. - we want LOW coupling. - Coupling is high when a change in one part of your system causes problems in another part of your system. Alan Kay: "Late Binding and Loose Coupling of everything,and hiding of state and state process"
